bow: hi mommit fairly new postpartum nurse and love to hear things you appreciated did appreciate about your experience in the hospital after giving birth so that can keep your suggestions in mind while caring for my new moms and babies some things like the fundal massages just suck know but do try to educate moms and keep them in the loop with what doing and why doing it love any suggestions you guys have or any stories you like to share about your postpartum experience thanks my first daughter passed away shortly after birth the nurses were kind enough to move me to private room so that wouldn have to look at other new moms and their babies was out of it and unaware of the special treatment at the time my second dd was in nicu for few days just to make sure that she was ok again the nurses moved me into my own room for the same reason asked one of the nurses the second time around why her words were were nurses but were also mothers my appreciation and respect of these woman grew 100 that day it was quiet kindness that didn ask for and they didn have to give but it happened and they saved me mountains of unnecessary pain so sorry to hear about the passing of your daughter ca imagine how hard that must be in my hospital we put moms who had fetal demise or nicu moms in rooms by the entrance so they do have to be around the other moms with their babies thanks for your response it always the little things that mean the most for sure when my sister had my nephew he was swept away to the nicu and they still put her with new moms and their babies felt like after gave birth didn matter at all it was all about the baby wish nurse would have cared more for me as patient plan on mentioning this to the hospital delivered at breastfeeding was encouraged which was totally on board with however received very minimal training was only shown one position and there was basically no other discussion first time mom had had no idea about milk coming in alternate nursing positions how to store milk after pumping etc maybe your hospital provides different information but ve found in general that this is the case for many new moms in my area luckily resourceful and did lot of homework myself over the next few days however moms decide to feed their babies feel like there should be little more education before going home with my first nurse came in and announced the baby needed bath she did ask she told did feel like could refuse or even ask to wait till my so was back from his grocery run during our hospital stay often did stand up for myself because did want to inconvenience the nurses was given the feeling that just how it is and other moms are in labor so do do that same with the breast pump they provided one but it wasn until was using it for few days one of the nurses noticed was using it on let down setting for full 30 min each time without switching through to regular pump mode oh your poor boobies loved that my nurses let me know what all my options were and respected my decisions on things one night in the hospital or two taking baby to the nursery for bit so could get some rest meds that was offered after delivery etc no one told me about the after birth shakes was shaking so uncontrollably my husband thought was having seizure removed understand why but the nurses coming in every 30 minutes drove my husband and crazy they would sometimes come in right after one had left and take my temp and blood pressure etc again literally minutes after my baby and had zero complications but it was an unplanned section so understand they have to check on us but it was the little things that started to grate on us do you need juice do you want juice have you been offered juice every 10 minutes during the day swear oh my god we are good on the juice situation haha not saying do go in as much because get that that is not an option but find way to do it without having to talk so much or ask the same non medical questions that everyone has asked the poor couple 000 000 times in the last 24 hours including simple ones like asking if they are happy about the baby like duh now can try to sleep before the next nurse is in to wake me up so she can sort of tap my iv bag and then walk out of the room again thanks haha loved our nurses except one because she was just arrogant seeming and talked down to me but she was only there overnight and the morning nurse was lot nicer so let it go and totally understand that bedside manner is important but was so not focused on them was focused on my baby and husband and all the same small talk with multiple nurses got annoying and in the way sometimes this is just nursing in general but bundle your cares nurse too and was super annoyed when my pp nurse would come in for one thing leave and 10 mins later come back for another when they could ve been done together was ready to get out of there and she was just dragging it out removed removed one of my nurses told me not to let my day old manipulate me into holding her by crying since was on bedrest with mag drip had to wait for her to leave so my husband could bring the baby to me do be that kind of nurse when was labouring in the hospital the epidural think was making me sick and was periodically puking it was made 1000x worse when one particular nurse would come in reeking of some sort of perfume know scented products are already banned in most hospital but this woman obviously didn care complained to my midwife after the kid was born and she told me the lady was the head nurse on the floor such thoughtless action that actively affected my health not to mention some people are so allergic to perfumes have friend who would have gone into respiratory distress being near that woman on top of being in labour removed feel the same way about my birthing experience my baby had to be flown to hospital with nicu and once he left didn exist to them anymore wouldn wish that experience on anyone guuurrlllll can see where you be frustrated but would have done anything to trade experiences my nurses were non existent they had separate vitals only nurse who came in for that but wasn able to do anything else at all but beyond that if it wasn for all the baby nurses and doctors have thought the hospital was pretty much abandoned surely there must be happy medium agree 100 with my first who was very angry and excessively loud high pitched but otherwise very healthy newborn they were coming in to do vitals and other checks all the time we would finally get him settled and would start resting and they would come in and have to wake him for this check was under the impression it had to be done so was just miserable and exhausted with my second my nurse gave me an option do you want me to hold off on checks if your lights are off and all is quiet omg really you can it was huge blessing to actually try to sleep when he slept and stay peacefully quiet so yeah that give moms an option to rest if their baby allows it removed like lot of other women said basically felt invisible once the baby was out weird combination of invisible and perpetually pestered no one barely asked about me or how felt just about the baby and how the baby was doing while am very grateful for their concern about my baby did just have major surgery section although it done massive amount of good concerned that the baby friendly hospital initiative has swung too far in the other direction most of my friends have stories about pushy amp condescending lactation consultants and these people that were breastfeeding had really bad experience myself my milk came in fast amp in very large quantities but my boobs were so hard that my son couldn latch and had an excessive let down so he would just wind up drowning when he did finally latch he was hungry and crying was in so much pain from overfilled boobs that was crying lc and nurses refused to give me breast pump because it would interfere with breastfeeding asked about times and was refused each time finally sent my husband to go buy manual pump then got side eyed and lectured when anyone saw me using it please be supportive of your patients had this same experience people kept coming in demanding things from me after the third time the nurse comes in you have to go pee now and had slept all night the birth certificate lady needs me to fill out the birth certificate they need to take my temp amd bp right now at this moment my husband has been sleeping in the corner for eleven hours my breakfast is getting cold baby wo latch and want more pain medicine just burst into tears can just eat something first think they backed off bit after they saw me crying though okay mine is very specific but they set me up with narcotic pump after my section didn ask for it and they didn tell me when asked for sleep aid long labor hadn slept in 48 hours at that point they said couldn have it until used all the narcotics in my pump asked for it to be taken away because pressing the button every 15 minutes wasn conducive to sleep they wouldn was miserable it wasn touching my pain eventually someone took pity on me and brought me 1000mg of iv tylenol and finally got some relief and slept so basically educate the moms on the meds ask if they ll need help sleeping before giving them narcotics basically listen to their pain cus had my pain 100 dismissed really struggled with bf and was really leaning towards formula but every nurse that asked just kept sending in more lactation consultants legitimately borderline refusing to bring me the formula and nipples that are available so spent 72 hours showing having 10 different lactation consultants give me tips was open to pumping but was told not to like get breast is best but felt that all my agency was taken away my husband finally put his foot down on the third day as my daughter continued to lose weight quite rapidly he went to the nurses desk and demanded formula tldr new moms might not have the gumption to really push for their own choices please be an advocate not an obstacle which also led to me not sleeping at all in the hospital that sucked wait what is that it happened to me when was by myself but never asked have three different perspectives on this with my first two children was young and terrified the nurses treated me like was terrible person for having baby they offered minimal education and just were short and rude at the time did really understand that it was about my age it was until went to nursing school myself and started working as an lpn at another hospital that saw how caring education focused nurses worked with young moms yes teenage mothers are giving their kids harder chance at life yes it would usually be better if they did have kids that young but they had them huge amount of the issues of teen parenting could be alleviated if they were taught basic parenting skills and *empowered* with my next three children was little older nurse and at the hospital worked at the best thing the nurses did there was honoring my wish to have my child with me at all times and giving us room down the hall so did feel guilty about having my other kids there so much with one of them the nurse strongly advocated for me when the on call doctor did want to let me leave pp day so guess just knowing how to gauge moms level of understanding and comfort then educating or advocating based on that with my youngest she came after almost decade of me being infertile and was born at 26+3 she was transferred to different hospital with nicu the best things my pp nurses did in that situation was making sure was eating drinking slowly recovering from the csection so could be dismissed to go to my daughter they also coordinated with the nicu lactation nurse to make sure had all the supplies needed so could pump and send tiny syringes of colostrum and milk to the nicu with my partner running it over the nicu nurses were awesome about calling throughout the day to let me know how she was doing and then making me feel so so so welcome and part of the care team when was finally discharged and at the nicu daily had to give my son formula the first night really did want to but we doctor included agreed it was the right move help with nursing was sparse and brusque and the next day nurse told me well the night nurse said you were even ***trying*** so that sucked studies show that often women are told what is really going on with their bodies because doctors and nurses do want to be considered downer on such happy day dang though wish someone was just honest with me that my bleeding was normal am rational human being who had great nurses especially during delivery but no one was honest with me about my postpartum bleeding you can do it with smile on your face but knowledge is powerful and should be shared had nurse who just didn vibe with am nurse practitioner so ve been around this nurse insisted on being right about everything had been on beta blockers and then my ob abruptly withdrew them dumb so got rebound hypertension pointed this out to the confused staff when my bp shot up this woman insisted it was other stuff and blah blah blah my hubby got me my meds at half dose to start tapering and all was better we really didn mesh she also barged in and said it bath time for baby proceeded to not let my husband touch my daughter when did ob didn touch taught my hubby wanted to give her the bath not watch don take power away from new parents because it is faster or easier coach and guide them what the worst that happens parents miss spot okay just make sure the baby is warm enough good luck you ll do great wtf maybe have little thought for those new mom placed outside of the ward had to stay in the children wing to be near the nicu had private room but no privacy was never allowed to get any sleep at all in three days was given any privacy sign and the worst thing was that they never gave me any of those yummy lactation cookies had asked all my nighttime nurses to wake me any time my daughter was leaving the room for tests etc the first night nurse who came on duty after was asleep came in and took her out for tests woke up to an empty room panicking that someone had taken my baby if you take the baby for testing while mom is sleeping wake her up to notify her or at least write note on the board so she does freak out like did with my first they asked me sooooo many times about circumcision for my son no is no should only have to tell them once delivered my second weeks ago was only asked once same hospital noticed this lot with my first the nurses continually questioned my decisions with my second they did much better experience with my second just because someone is first time mom that does mean they do know what they want ohhhhh how loved my nurses and still do we sent them card with photos thanking them for all their support in fact may send another now that we re at months above all they showed genuine care and compassion they explained everything they did and did everything tenderly as though they were caring for family member that the most important thing and will forever be grateful to them one thing still remember is that they tell me when they needed to get vital signs next at night so could just hit the call button whenever my daughter woke up between and instead of getting back to sleep at 1:45 and having them check vitals 10 minutes later that happened to me too and it was so scary nurse came in and put something magical into my iv demerol and it was all good wholeheartedly agree as nurse myself psych so amp is completely foreign and scary to me the nurses were just amazing and think the fact that the op is here concerned and asking for experiences means that she is going to pick up on patient family cues and is going to do an exceptional job agree my son was in the intermediate care unit not nicu but needing bit of monitoring and wanted to nurse so every three hours was going down the hall for that spending 30 40 minutes there then back to my room doze off then immediately got woken up to check the uterus then 10 minutes later another nurse would check my temperature was on prophylactic antibiotics for 24 hours they wanted me to pump colllostrum too then the doctor stopped by then meal and back to nursing did sleep for 72 hours it was torture yes all of this help mom and baby with feeding whatever that looks like starved my first child because of breast is best and made us all miserable nurse who did insist on being lactivist crazy could have saved us so much suffering was scheduled section first time mom and was breast feeding because have narcolepsy and had to get back on my medication no one explained how my milk would come in week later with colic baby and severe post partumn called my mom at two am sobbing uncontrollably with screaming baby and milk literally dripping from my soaked shirt and so painful so maybe education on this and post partumn resources especially if there are young mother support groups my first had tongue tie the nurses were amazing at helping us start breastfeeding but they did check her for tie even when she was struggling to get good latch they figured out right away that she had disorganized suck but did look in her mouth to figure out why it did help that the hospital two lcs were there the whole time was baby was born friday afternoon we left sunday but ended up befriending the public health folks helping the hospital with their baby friendly designation and because of this story all babies get checked for tongue tie before they go home that is awful ☹️ my hospital had such strong hospitality commitment that felt like was in hotel it was nice but felt bad for the nurses because could see some patients really taking advantage pretty much never nude and had hard time being exposed in front of strangers when my son was born almost month early and spent some time in the nicu the lc started me pumping immediately because of said never nude status was little awkward about her attempts to help me figure out pumping after involuntarily physically recoiled from her third or fourth attempt to grab handful of my boob to cram in the pump she pushed the pump away from the bed and goes do you even want to do this did was just freaked out turns out it was her last shift ever before retiring but that woman was certified nipple nazi and her militant lactation support almost made me give up before we even got started this was my experience 100 did like feeling so alone with baby nurses were in and out quickly and no one asked me how was holding up did okay but would have appreciated small amount of attention since my husband had to stay home after the birth the worse part for me was feeling talked down to this was my second baby know how to hand express feeding cues etc only one nurse was guilty of that though same nurse did the blood tests on baby hectically after had finally gotten the baby to sleep after hours nursing was pissed one nurse the best one physically showed me moves not to attempt while healing from section she did everything possible to remove the dozens of tape pieces from my skin painlessly and she even traded out my bed for better one if you go above and beyond it noticed still remember years later after had my first baby via section and was struggling to establish breastfeeding everyone was full of advice but low on support it was lactation consultant who gave me what needed she looked at me and said everything is going to be okay burst into tears just needed some encouragement more than anything else so sorry to hear that always try to make my moms feel heard and cared about if you do mind me asking what exactly did the nurse do to make you feel like it was all about the baby removed that is the worst so sorry said in another reply how like to present the bath to moms we do delayed baths after hours and some nurses think it like hour mark=bath right now but it not my kid will ask when if they want to do the bath how involved they want to be and sometimes push the bath onto the day shift nurse which gets me lot of attitude if mom is too tired and wants to film it be part of it work really hard with my moms and prioritize my nights based on what they need not what will make day shift happy what ew screw that breastfeeding is soooo involved it can also be extremely stressful and lot of the times comfort crying moms who have been up for hours and baby is crying and not latching or falling asleep it awful how hard it can be we have lactation specialists but it mostly the pp nurses that educate and help with breast feeding removed removed certified nipple nazi oh good point yeah remember in nursing school had super strict professor who had really dumb rules about everything but her one rule about no perfume in clinicals especially ob stuck with me lol try to cluster care plan with you when you re going to be awake and let the cna know when to go in with me etc and show dad where our little kitchen is on the floor so he can grab snacks water and juice that way can spend time more quality time quality not quantity with my patients and not so much time getting snacks juice when you guys can help yourself when you first get to the unit we have transition vitals which means we re checking baby every hour for the first 4hours but after that we can coordinate with you to check baby when it good time oh yes they can be bad that and the temp instability yeah that understood perfectly but this went on for the entirety of my 36 hour stay with him in hindsight it was ridiculous at the time was first time mom in total state of confusion who knew nothing despite being health care professional myself the other night had very similar situation with mom she confided in me that the lactation people made her feel judged because she was struggling to breastfeed they would allow her to pump even after she asked for one brought her pump and she was like oh thank god lol yaaas that just rude nursing aside hate hate hate when people act like they re always right it one of the worst traits in my opinion you re not the first person to mention the bath thing we do delayed bathing after hours but ll always ask when they want the baby to get bath since work nights they usually want to wait until the next day which totally get but the day shift nurses get sooo pissed about it but that fine work really hard and try to get as much done as possible never leave tasks to the next shift out of laziness yeah no would panic too yes understanding your role here as an educator is huge left the hospital feeling kind of po ed with my postpartum nurses and chalked it up to the hospital just hiring mediocre staff on that unit think you will be great the fact that you care enough to ask these questions is huge were you put under general anesthesia or something pca pumps are the norm after sections and if you ask for it out they should have advocated for you and told anesthesia ob that you were requesting to get it removed awe thank you sorry you went through that yes education is super important so this is weird thing that may just be my hospital idk but as nurses we re not allowed to diagnose tongue tie we check for it and we ll let the lc know and they can diagnose it we can say disorganized suck but not tongue tie weird know that sucks sorry glad you had great nurse that other one probably should have coordinated better with you because labs usually have window of time that they need to be done awe love this like to tell my moms that everything going to be okay and it normal to be overwhelmed and that they re doing good job awe thank you trying not mom so do know what it feels like to be patient in amp or postpartum these answers are really helpful and going to keep them in mind that really weird since could get seen by an lc really resented being sent off with no knowledge of what was causing us problems this one will be strange so get ready my toilet was so short not an excessively tall person it was just so short after my section my husband had to pick me up to set me on the toilet it was the most painful part of my recovery begged the nurses for the seat to make it taller and they ignored me my husband had to raise hell with the charge nurse to make it happen was not on the mom and baby floor was in antepartum because was on bed rest before surgery and my babies were in the nicu also the amount of unnecessary equipment in the room bothered me will admit to being neat freak hate clutter but could not fully access my small room because of all the unused equipment that the nurses refused to move lastly the nurses would want to talk to me like just polite chit chat but hours because triplets was exhausted and wanted to sleep before the next time they had to bother me thankfully my husband started kicking people out this woman and weren gon na get along and had her nights oh well we laugh about it now can get along with all your patients this was delayed bathing too smart to not leave tasks to the next shift you ll get dumped on really quick it hard to find balance would think on unit that requires so much education and support it tricky to do you ll find your rhythm was not nope was an emergent though don know why was given it but just wanted to sleep lol removed would have cared what she thought but she should have said it out loud or put dd out of my reach upshot do let your opinions negatively affect patient care my nurses were pretty much awesome but we were one of the only ones in the birthing center for much of our stay we were there about week because of section and jaundiced baby which meant many of the nurses would just come hang out in our room it was nice but after while just wanted some alone time also each and every single nurse had different way to show me how to breastfeed which was overwhelming every shift the new one tried to show me something that was guaranteed to work we did end up getting the hang of it until weeks later lol my nurses were awesome **i am hate hospitals type person and my birthing experience totally turned it around for me ** my nurses were about me dad and baby and were sooo kind gentle **loved** **that they educated me ** **this is tmi but it sticks out in my mind and appreciated it ** had my first poop and *could tell if wiped all the way and was scared too wipe too close to my stiches my nurse checked for me thank you nurse who mommed for me still love you gave her hug before was discharged nurses were happy to teach me about breastfeeding and after care for baby and me it all helped so much they helped me make sure showered safely **they laughed at my jokes** that was so nice lt they did give me too much slack if declined med or something wish got the stool softener day earlier was afraid of it giving me diarhea did realize it simply *softened* my stool so did take it for day when probably could have used the extra day to get it goin teach the scared moms that they wo get diarhea haha lt we were discharged hours later than they said but did care too much that stuff is out of the nurse hands sure **during delivery** do think would have ripped if only the ob was talking to me but had nurse the ob and my doula all telling me when to push and think if we all just calmed down bit and it was the ob and communicating bet could have prevented ripping at least ripped less so that is goal for next time loved my ob she was calm and collected but because of that could hear her haha as someone who is very allergic to perfume second this remember the one thing ever snapped at my bridesmaids about was them trying to spray perfume extremely grateful my nurses currently in labor are all perfume free migraine would be wayyyy too much for me right now ugh the nurse came in at 11pm the second night we were in the hospital and gave the baby bath we had the lights off and my husband and were trying to finally sleep she didn ask just told us it was time for his bath and we didn know that we could say no and just went along with it my favourite postpartum moments with nurses from both my births in no particular order with both dd1 and dd2 when the nurse helped me to the toilet for my first pee they offered to fill my peri bottle for me with dd1 right before sat down to pee the nurse warned me that this was going to be uncomfortable and not to be scared worried genuinely had no idea my first post birth pee was going to feel like the fires of hell were dribbling out of me so the heads up was good with dd1 the nurse always asked are you decent before coming all the way into my room with dd2 the nurse made sure had fresh gown on standby in my room at all times she said done something too important and amazing to sit in my own sweat leaked blood for even moment had the postpartum sweats really bad with both dd1 and dd2 with dd2 the nurse told me about how her firstborn reacted adjusted when she had her second baby it was really touching and took some worry off of my mind with dd1 the nurse offered to help me wash my hair declined but was still touched by the offer nobody told me had third degree tear until just before discharge and even then it was like good luck with that tear it doozy would have appreciated some information about what had happened to my body during delivery and maybe some instructions for care amp x200b btw thanks for asking think the fact that you care enough to ask this question means you ll probably be pretty great nurse was very lucky and had amazing nurses however the one that was with me while was waiting for my epidural kept telling me to breathe through it when was having contractions after asking her nicely to stop because it wasn helping three times got rude not proud of it but honestly wanted to punch her the nurse who came in after he was born helped me do skin to skin for as long as wanted was so kind and waited until we were ready to bathe him and let my husband be right there with him the whole time then once we were in the recovery room the nurses helped me to breast feed when was crying and felt utterly helpless because had no sleep as had labored the entire night before just be kind that all can say we had great experience because the nurses were all just kind also if desperate pair of new parents asks you to take the baby so that they can sleep for an hour and half because they literally have not slept in days please do it without making them feel horrible cried because felt like was terrible mother already asking them to take him so could nap and he would not stop crying if those nurses had given me any additional guilt on top of what gave myself think would have spiraled my biggest complaint was nurses telling me what was feeling especially with nursing was at baby friendly hospital so all the nurses were supposed to be trained to help teach how to breastfeed but they kept telling me it did hurt they said the baby was latched right and it did hurt but it did hurt and have decent pain tolerance level it was the most frustrating thing my husband was out grabbing us food daughter only two weeks old now and while he was out experienced some weakness in my hands so pages for the midwife as she said not to ignore signs like that during my wait also expirenced blurred vision panicked and paged again nurse who had met yet came in to check on me burst into tears and she sat on my bed and held me never got her name and never saw her after that but that one moment of comfort meant so much to me let me take shower after give birth me going to shower husband will it be quick one in case the doctor comes in me our precious daughter *pooped inside of me* 24 hours ago she continued to do so all day as labored in an tub of that and then they wouldn let me take shower the night she was born so no don think it will be very quick or at least make an effort to put the baby back to sleep after you check them almost cried tears of joy when one nurse did that for me my doctor did his same thing for me after baby was rushed to nicu dad went with her and was just left alone having given birth but no baby in my arms loved my postpartum experience one of the nurses that really stood out heated my baby foot with little heating pad before his newborn screening blood draw he did cry at all through the screening she was also fantastic swaddler and at the beginning of her shift had already reviewed my file and said so it looks like our goals today are to work on breastfeeding and swaddling right she helped me figure out different latches another nurse appreciated because she told me about the gel soothies pads for nipple pain even though they did give them away at the hospital appreciated the recommendation so could send my husband to walgreens right away to get some
